issue.title: Failed to build OQS-OpenSSL_1_1_1-stable
issue.body: Hi, I followed the Quickstart to build OQS-OpenSSL_1_1_1-stable. When I built the OpenSSL, I got some error messages. The following are my instructions: ``` sudo ./Configure shared linux-x86_64 -lm --prefix=/usr/local/ssl --openssldir=/usr/local/ssl -DOQS_DEFAULT_GROUPS=\"p256_kyber512:X25519:p256_hqc128\" sudo make -j 4 sudo make test ``` There is no error in the first two instructions. But when I typed "sudo make test", I got some errors. Is the setting of `-DOQS_DEFAULT_GROUPS` wrong? Or is the algorithm not supported?

comment.body:
>Does the same error happen in your environment when you build static? 

Yes, it also has the same error.
>What if you build dynamic without setting `OQS_DEFAULT_GROUPS`(I'm not sure we tested the test suite when setting --other-- default groups)?

No error occurred. All tests successful.

issue.title: Fixes necessary to compile on raspberry pi 4 with clang
issue.body:
The changes in this PR where needed to compile on a raspbery pi 4 using clang.
I do not know if they are portable or correct, but they made the project compile on rpi4 and my x86_64 laptop!

The changes from `size_t` -> `uint64_t` where applied because of narrowed integers.

    $ clang -v
    clang version 7.0.1-8+rpi3+deb10u2 (tags/RELEASE_701/final)
    Target: armv6k-unknown-linux-gnueabihf
    Thread model: posix
    InstalledDir: /usr/bin
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/4.9
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/4.9.4
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/5
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/5.5.0
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/6
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/6.5.0
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/7
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/7.3.0
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/8
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/4.9
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/4.9.4
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/5
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/5.5.0
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/6
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/6.5.0
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/7
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/7.3.0
    Found candidate GCC installation: /usr/lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/8
    Selected GCC installation: /usr/bin/../lib/gcc/arm-linux-gnueabihf/8
    Candidate multilib: .;@m32
    Selected multilib: .;@m32

The `-Wno-language-extension-token` option was necessary because of the following warnings-turned-error:

    In file included from /home/karo/liboqs/tests/test_aes.c:13:
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:135:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mrc p15, 0, %0, c9, c13, 0\t\n"
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:164:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 0\t\n" ::"r"(value));
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:167:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 1\t\n" ::"r"(0x8000000f));
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:170:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 3\t\n" ::"r"(0x8000000f));
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:135:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mrc p15, 0, %0, c9, c13, 0\t\n"
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:164:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 0\t\n" ::"r"(value));
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:167:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 1\t\n" ::"r"(0x8000000f));
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:170:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 3\t\n" ::"r"(0x8000000f));
            ^
    In file included from /home/karo/liboqs/tests/speed_sig.c:14:
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:135:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mrc p15, 0, %0, c9, c13, 0\t\n"
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:164:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 0\t\n" ::"r"(value));
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:167:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 1\t\n" ::"r"(0x8000000f));
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:170:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 3\t\n" ::"r"(0x8000000f));
            ^

comment.body:
For the "extension used" warning, I think the solution is to use `__asm__` not `asm`, so I've tried that switch.

As for the removal of `static`, I notice that it's part of `static __inline`, but I think `__inline` is compiler-specific (MSVC), and that perhaps it should be `inline` or `__inline__`.  Do you have any insight @koraa or @christianpaquin?

    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:135:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mrc p15, 0, %0, c9, c13, 0\t\n"
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:164:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]

            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 3\t\n" ::"r"(0x8000000f));
            ^
    In file included from /home/karo/liboqs/tests/speed_sig.c:14:
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:135:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mrc p15, 0, %0, c9, c13, 0\t\n"
            ^
    /home/karo/liboqs/tests/ds_benchmark.h:164:2: error: extension used [-Werror,-Wlanguage-extension-token]
            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 0\t\n" ::"r"(value));

            asm volatile("mcr p15, 0, %0, c9, c12, 1\t\n" ::"r"(0x8000000f));

            ^

comment.body:
Thank you for the changes! I've compiled on my pi4 and it still compiles properly.

You are probably correct about the static inline thing…the fact that this compiles on other platforms indicates that this was probably intentional.

I would suggest asking the person who originally wrote the function for their intention there; the meanings of these two flags are numerous and subtly but importantly different on various platforms. Even if we find out something about compilers and the difference between `inline` and `__inline` and `__inline__` there's still a chance that the mental model of the original author was off…

issue.title: Win 10, package compilation step fails to find OpenSSL
issue.body:
I'm on Win 10, VS code. Adding oqs = "*" or oqs-sys = "*" in Cargo.toml causes a build step to occur which fails with this message:

```
CMake Error at C:/Program Files/CMake/share/cmake-3.20/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:230 (message):        
    Could NOT find OpenSSL, try to set the path to OpenSSL root folder
```
Installing OpenSSL and setting OPENSSL_ROOT_DIR environment variable as the message suggests has no effect.

comment.body:
How have you set the build var? Is it visible in whatever the Windows equivalent to `env` is`?

You might also choose to just disable the `openssl` feature.

issue.title: Win 10, package compilation step fails to find OpenSSL
issue.body:
I'm on Win 10, VS code. Adding oqs = "*" or oqs-sys = "*" in Cargo.toml causes a build step to occur which fails with this message:

```
CMake Error at C:/Program Files/CMake/share/cmake-3.20/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:230 (message):        
    Could NOT find OpenSSL, try to set the path to OpenSSL root folder
```
Installing OpenSSL and setting OPENSSL_ROOT_DIR environment variable as the message suggests has no effect.

comment.body: I set it using setx in a cmd window which should set it globally for my user identity. I then reopened the window in which I was doing the build and checked it was correct in the env. How can I disable the openssl feature? I only have the Cargo.toml entry to work with as far as I can see.

I'm on Win 10, VS code. Adding oqs = "*" or oqs-sys = "*" in Cargo.toml causes a build step to occur which fails with this message:

```
CMake Error at C:/Program Files/CMake/share/cmake-3.20/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:230 (message):

```
Installing OpenSSL and setting OPENSSL_ROOT_DIR environment variable as the message suggests has no effect.

comment.body: OK it compiles with that setting, many thanks. I believe I get all the algorithms with that setting above in v0.6 which is what is in crates.io right now but that will change with 0.7 where I'll have to pick the algorithms as features, let me know if that's incorrect.

issue.title: State of platform specific optimizations
issue.body:
Thank you for building liboqs!

I am targeting an arm platform, it would be nice to be able to use the arm specific optimizations available. Does liboqs include the arm optimized versions from pqm4? I haven't been able to find any mention of pqm4 in this repo so I suppose not?

comment.body: Closing for now since there seems to be no specific action required.
